title: A look at FedEx's sustainability policy - Sustainability Magazine
summary: FedEx, a global express transportation company, has set a goal of achieving carbon-neutral operations by 2040, 10 years ahead of the Paris Climate Agreement timeline. This goal is being pursued through a combination of strategies including vehicle electrification, sustainable fuels, and optimizing operations with technology. The company emphasizes the importance of sustainability throughout their operations, from packaging to facility design, aiming to meet both customer expectations for speed and environmental responsibility.
product_or_process: Electric vehicles, FedEx Delivery Manager, AI-powered robotic sorting arms, 100% recyclable packaging, green building design
likely_naics_codes: ['484110 - General Freight Trucking', '484121 - Specialized Freight Trucking', '488490 - Other Support Activities for Transportation', '532490 - Other Courier Services']
greenwashing: The article presents FedEx's sustainability efforts as genuine and comprehensive, with specific details about their initiatives and progress, indicating a lack of greenwashing.

summary: Fashion executives anticipate a year of sustainability action in 2023, but for that to happen, they need to lead the way. This article emphasizes the importance of executives taking concrete steps towards sustainability instead of just making predictions.

title: AgriSound's insect listening device installed at Cranswick farms to monitor pollination - Pig World
summary: Cranswick, a British food products supplier, has partnered with AgriSound to install solar-powered insect sensor devices called Polly on their pig farms. These devices monitor pollinator activity and provide real-time data on biodiversity, which can be used to optimize crop yield and implement pollinator-protection measures. Cranswick aims to demonstrate the positive role pigs can play in promoting biodiversity and soil health.
